text: Question:Putting aside the practical implications of re-modelling the existing facilities to accommodate to female cadets  what good reasons are there that women don't have to fork out 2 years of their lives to serve the nation?
I'm genuinely curious  not here to force my opinion
I‚Äôll try to think of a response
Imma be honest i don't think there are any
My current stance is that it's more of society'spotentially patriarchalperspective of women rather than any actual good reasons  on why women don't have to serve NS
I have thought about this for most of my sec and jc life LOL
I strongly agree! Can't rly think of stuff rn so i agree w this
ya i ask my teacher  they roll their eyes

Long story short(not short) Compare 2 lives1. You have the stereotypical PSC scholar  'studied very hard' 90rp  can't do much CCA cuz no $(so no music)  maybe Librarian Vice Pres. Assuming he indicates interest in certain areas of SAF  he will enter a different world which is only accepting of people who area. generally paid highlyb. accountable to few people  but in the same manner  should be highly accountable to themc. accepts no moral failings  and certainly not the kind involving moneyThe environment is shaped by these systematic requirements.2. Stereotypical NS boiboi. Normal life. Went through BMT mono. Considering that 'discipline' is important  safety rules are thrown out the window. The lesson is simple: don't die  don't get caught doing stuff not to be done.How can these two people ever meet?

The super important and practical implication of changing any part of NS as it is. Have you seen NS numbers? Tell me which ruling political party in their right mind would change a policy in support by up to 90%+ of the population
That's the political perspective I suppose
In SG  it won't be that much lower than number 1
actly i feel this is damn valid
Let her foreves be lazy HAHAHA

PAP preaches the "we want to do what's right  not what is popular" when doing things like raising taxes or building casinos  but I guess they're not internally inconsistent when it comes to policies that are more impactful and polarizing (377A and women in NS) I suppose

I've not seen high support of NS for women in polls anyway. The highest numbers IIRC re women is when they are not necessarily going combat  and go into stuff like nursing/healthcare.But actually still a lot of practical problems to handle with hat
Preach all it wants. It is a political party.
It's not valid  it's basically saying "there is no good reason except for the fact that women will resist the policy change and PAP will lose supporters"
Valid but not right of course
Political support should not be the only thing holding the party back from making such a decision
This is why anarchy is the best/s
Then again i am simultaneously for and against NS

> raising taxesYa  and tell me how to support the poor without revenue? They already doing the NIRF or whatever GIC framework alr  so they are tapping onto many many revenue streams> building casinosholy shit 2% of GDP - which rich man is going to give 2%? 2% of GDP means jobs  buildings  schools  AIRCON
Even if somewhat 'unpopular' these obvious (somewhat) economic policies will gain PAP more votes in the long run

A fair point is also the fact that a much larger % of women won't get very good PES with the current system  so the system may need to be tweaked quite a bit to suite that. Training will definitely need to be different if ippt standards for women change too
